England were 48/4 when Bairstow came in to bat and added 67 runs with Ben Stokes for the fifth wicket. He then added 99 runs with Ben Foakes.

174.title: PMC to start classes for 1st batch of MBBS at new medical college
174.article_body: After receiving approval from National Medical Commission(NMC), Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is set to start classes for first batch of 100 MBBS students at its new medical college. The Bharat Ratna Atal Bihari Vajpayee Medical College will commence classes from December this year, PMC Mayor Murlidhar Mohol said. The college will be under Maharashtra University of Health Sciences, Nashik.

175.title: I wanted to spend money on my body after being skin-shamed: Tejasswi
175.article_body: Speaking about dealing with body-shaming, actress Tejasswi Prakash said she used to feel bad at that time. She added, "I was...receiving negative comments because I was underweight." Tejasswi added she wanted to spend money on her body after she was called out for being skinny. "It was...tempting but then I told myself...if I...change myself, I'm no different," she added.

176.title: 35 MP natives stuck at Ukraine's Sumy likely to return tonight: State govt
176.article_body: Nearly 35 natives of Madhya Pradesh stuck in Ukraine's Sumy city have left the country and are likely to reach India by tonight, state Home Minister Narottam Mishra said on Wednesday. "All are safe...and...in touch with their family members," Mishra added. The MP government had announced that it will arrange for stay, food and transportation of students returning from Ukraine.

177.title: China to send humanitarian aid worth 5 million yuan to Ukraine
177.article_body: The Chinese Red Cross will send humanitarian assistance worth 5 million yuan (over ₹6 crore) to Ukraine, said the Chinese foreign ministry on Wednesday. The announcement comes amid the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine, which has resulted in lakhs of Ukrainians fleeing the country. The country is also facing shortage of food, water and electricity.

178.title: Father, his sons arrested for kidnapping student, demanding ₹7 lakh in B'luru
178.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested a father, his sons for allegedly abducting a 21-year-old student from his residence and demanding a ransom of ₹7 lakh. The kidnappers earlier used to be neighbours of the student and were aware that his mother had received a share of his father's ancestral property after his death, which was sold last year, the police said.

179.title: Pune govt hospital superintendent demands bribe from pvt doctor, held
179.article_body: The medical superintendent of a sub-district hospital in Bhor taluka in Pune district has been booked for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹10,000 from a private doctor. The 60-year-old accused had demanded the bribe for not giving a negative report about the sonography centre in the hospital run by the doctor. The accused was nabbed while accepting ₹5,000 on Tuesday.

180.title: US man caught smuggling 52 lizards, snakes in packets hidden in his clothes
180.article_body: A 30-year-old man from the US was caught trying to smuggle as many as 52 reptiles including 43 horned lizards and nine snakes at a border crossing with Mexico. According to customs officials, the man, who was driving a truck, kept the reptiles tied up in small bags which were hidden in his jacket, pants pockets and groin area.

181.title: Mumbai court sentences man to 5-yr-jail for daughter-in-law's suicide
181.article_body: A sessions court in Mumbai sentenced an 82-year-old man to five years of rigorous imprisonment for allegedly abetting the suicide of his daughter-in-law 11 years ago. The court noted that he repeatedly abused her in a drunken state and threatened to kill her. "It is not expected by any daughter-in-law that she would be given such inhuman treatment," it added.

182.title: Australian Army Chief pays respects at National War Memorial in Delhi
182.article_body: Chief of Australian Army, Lieutenant General Rick Burr, paid his respects to the martyred Indian soldiers and laid a wreath at the National War Memorial in Delhi on Wednesday. Burr, who is on a two-day visit to India, was received by the Army Chief General Manoj Mukund Naravane. He was also given a Guard of Honour at the South Block.

183.title: Pics of crowds at Soviet Union's 1st McDonald's surface as firm shuts Russian shops
183.article_body: Pictures showing long queues outside Soviet Union's first McDonald's on its opening day surfaced online after the company temporarily shut restaurants in Russia. The first McDonald's opened in Moscow's Pushkin Square in 1990, symbolising the opening of USSR to the West. "I stood in line for...an hour to get a cheeseburger in 1990...It's a sad day," a Twitter user said.

184.title: ICC announces Player of the Month nominations for February, 3 Indians included
184.article_body: ICC has announced Player of the Month nominations for February, with three Indians included across the two categories. Shreyas Iyer, who won Player of the Series award for scoring three unbeaten fifties against Sri Lanka in T20Is, has been nominated in men's category, while Mithali Raj and Deepti Sharma have been nominated for ICC Women's Player of the Month award.

185.title: National agencies get trained by BJP, fabricate cases: Raut
185.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said national agencies like NCB, CBI and ED get trained by BJP and fabricate cases, not Maharashtra Police. "False cases are never filed against anybody in Maharashtra," he added. Referring to Ex-Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis' claims that Maharashtra government is working to frame BJP leaders, Raut said, "His sensational remarks are maligning state police."

186.title: Global carbon dioxide emissions reach highest level in history: Experts
186.article_body: The global emission of carbon dioxide (CO2) has reached its highest levels in history, experts said. CO2 emissions rose by 6% in 2021 to 36.3 billion metric tons, a report stated. During pandemic, carbon emission declined due to lesser consumption of fossil fuels but as the world economy rebounded post-COVID with heavy reliance on fossil fuels, CO2 emissions surged massively.

187.title: Russia claims Ukraine was planning to attack Donbass in March, shares 'secret' document
187.article_body: Russian foreign ministry shared a 'secret' document it allegedly acquired during special military operation in Ukraine. "Classified documents (order by Commander National Guard of Ukraine) confirm...Kiev regime was covertly preparing an offensive operation against Donbass [in] March 2022," it wrote. Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian separatists have been fighting in Donbass since 2014.

188.title: Why did US reject Poland's offer to provide its MiG-29 jets to Ukraine?
188.article_body: The US rejected Poland's offer to transfer its MiG-29 jets to a base in Germany to be provided to Ukraine in the war against Russia. The Pentagon said the prospect of flying combat aircraft from NATO territory into the war zone "raises serious concerns for the entire NATO alliance". NATO has said it does not want direct conflict with Russia.

189.title: More military at India & China borders increases risk of armed confrontation: US
189.article_body: The annual threat assessment of the US Intelligence Community stated that expanded military posture by both India and China along the disputed border elevates the risk of armed confrontation between two nuclear powers. It added that this "might involve direct threats to US persons and interests and calls for US intervention." It also said that Indo-China relations will remain strained.

190.title: Next generation bowlers can forget about 1000 int'l wickets: Ashwin on Warne
190.article_body: India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has said that the next generation of bowlers can forget about getting 1000+ international wickets, a record held by Shane Warne, who passed away last week, and Muttiah Muralitharan. "[Because] the volume of Test cricket will come down drastically. And also because there are so many leagues, workload management will take centre-stage," Ashwin explained.

191.title: Girl who sells balloons in Kerala turns model, makeover pics go viral
191.article_body: A balloon seller from Kerala has gone viral after photos of her makeover were posted online. The girl named Kisbu was selling balloons near a temple when she was spotted by photographer Arjun Krishnan, who took a few pictures of the teenager, one of which he posted on Instagram. It went viral and led to Kisbu starring in a photoshoot.

192.title: No 4th COVID wave in India unless a differently-behaving variant comes up: Virologist
192.article_body: Virologist Dr T Jacob John has said he is "fairly confident" that no fourth COVID-19 wave will occur in India unless an unexpected variant that behaves differently comes up. John, the former director of Indian Council for Medical Research's Centre of Advanced Research in Virology, said it can be confidently concluded that the third COVID-19 wave has ended.

193.title: Bumble removes all its dating apps from Russia & Belarus
193.article_body: Bumble is discontinuing its operations in Russia and removing all of its dating apps from Apple App Store and Google Play Store in Russia and Belarus. Bumble expects losing about $20 million in revenue in 2022 from this move. The combined revenue from Russia, Ukraine and Belarus was approximately 2.8% of its total revenue in 2021, mostly from Badoo app.

194.title: Bengaluru police shoot 2 murder accused in leg after they attack police
194.article_body: Bengaluru police on Wednesday allegedly opened fire to arrest two people wanted in a murder case. Reportedly, the men were on a two-wheeler and upon being confronted by the police, they attacked the policemen. Police, in order to defend themselves and arrest the culprits, then fired rounds at their legs to immobilise them, Times Now reported.

195.title: Pune court denies bail to medical student in ₹10-lakh extortion case
195.article_body: A Pune court on Monday denied bail to a medical student who was arrested for allegedly extorting ₹10 lakh from an engineering student. The accused, Amar Suryakant Poul, had allegedly sought money on pretext of establishing a media office and threatened to kill the victim if he didn't comply. Notably, Poul also has other cases of cheating registered against him.

196.title: Russia, Ukraine agree on day-long evacuation corridors
196.article_body: A Ukrainian official has said that Russia and Ukraine have agreed on day-long evacuation corridors to help civilians escape the war. Thousands are thought to have died or been wounded amid the biggest attack on a European state since World War II. Earlier, at least 10 people were killed in a Russian military attack in Severodonestk.

197.title: Poland offers to place its MiG-29 jets at US disposal to be provided to Ukraine
197.article_body: Poland has said that it is ready to deploy its MiG-29 jets to Ramstein Air Base in Germany and put them at US disposal for them to be provided to Ukraine. "Poland requests the US to provide us with used aircraft with corresponding operational capabilities. Poland is ready to immediately establish the conditions of purchase of the planes," it said.

198.title: Raising questions on EVM is anti-democratic: BJP to Akhilesh Yadav
198.article_body: Reacting to Akhilesh Yadav's claims of EVM tampering, the BJP said that raising questions on EVM is anti-democratic. "Akhilesh Yadav ji raising questions on EVMs is not only ridiculous but also anti-democratic. Did BJP question EVMs after defeat in Chhattisgarh, Rajasthan etc.?," BJP's Arvind Menon said. "Poor EVMs, they have to bear the brunt of Dynasts," BJP's CT Ravi said.

199.title: IPO-bound Mobikwik posts 1st-ever profit of ₹7 cr in Dec quarter
199.article_body: IPO-bound fintech firm Mobikwik recorded its first-ever profit of ₹7 crore in the December 2021 quarter after losing money in the first and second quarters. The company had achieved revenue of around ₹400 crore in the nine-month period ended December 31, an 86% growth on a year-on-year basis. It expects its full financial year of 2022-23 to be profitable.

200.title: I didn't know much English: Sushmita recalls answering Miss Universe question
200.article_body: Sushmita Sen recalled the question that led to her winning the 1994 Miss Universe pageant. Sushmita was asked, "What for you is the essence of being a woman?" In a recent interview, Sushmita revealed she was from Hindi medium school and didn't know much English at that time. "I don't know how...I answered that question with such clarity," she added.

201.title: Saw them painting faces, they broke with pain in time: Bhansali on sex workers
201.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali, while speaking to actress Alia Bhatt in an interview recalled how he saw sex workers during his childhood. "I saw them painting their faces and I saw their faces broken in time with pain. They were trying to look beautiful but looked uglier and uglier because it was distortion," Bhansali said.

202.title: Telangana govt to fill up 91,142 direct recruitment vacancies: CM KCR
202.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Wednesday announced the state government's decision to fill up 91,142 direct recruitment vacancies in the state. "The services of 11,103 contract employees working against direct recruitment vacancies will be regularised," he said. "The recruitment process for the remaining vacancies of 80,039 would be taken up immediately," Rao further said.

203.title: UP policeman congratulates BJP leader before poll results, probe ordered
203.article_body: A probe has been ordered against a policeman in Uttar Pradesh after he was seen congratulating BJP state vice-president Dayashankar Singh on becoming a cabinet minister ahead of the poll results in a video. A transfer order has also been issued for the policeman. The counting of votes of the 2022 UP Assembly elections is scheduled for March 10.

204.title: Sehwag congratulates Ashwin over 'mankading' rule change, says 'Ek karna zaroor'
204.article_body: Ex-cricketer Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to congratulate Ravichandran Ashwin after MCC removed 'mankading' from 'Unfair play' to 'Run-out' section in its laws. "Congratulations Ashwin, great week this one. First becoming second-highest [Test] wicket-taker for India...and now this. Ab full freedom to plot such run-outs with Buttler. Ek karna zaroor." Ashwin had 'mankaded' Buttler in IPL 2019.

205.title: No-confidence motion submitted against Pakistan PM to remove him from office
205.article_body: Pakistan's Opposition parties have submitted a no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan to remove him from office after holding his government responsible for the uncontrolled inflation. The motion was signed by about 100 lawmakers. Last year, Khan got 178 votes when he had decided to seek a vote of confidence after a candidate supported by his party lost Senate election.

206.title: I put on a lot of weight; was shocked to see those pics myself: Fardeen
206.article_body: Actor Fardeen Khan said people were shocked to see his pictures after he put on weight. "It wasn't that I was living in denial...I was...shocked when I saw those pictures myself," he added. "You can either let it work for you or let it destroy you. I'm not one of those who sits and wallows in self-pity," Fardeen said.

207.title: Millions of children trembling at every sound: Ukrainian model Veronika
207.article_body: Talking about the Russian invasion of Ukraine, Ukrainian model Veronika Didusenko said, "Millions of Ukrainian children..., their mothers are trembling at every sound...and...more heartbreaking are those forced to give birth." "Directly above my head, dozens of...helicopters...were bombing an...airfield," added Veronika. "Cities...are on the verge of a humanitarian catastrophe," stated the model.

208.title: 3 killed after being trapped in coal mine in Telangana’s Peddapalli
208.article_body: Three people were found dead after being trapped following an accident in Singareni Collieries in Telangana's Peddapalli district, the officials said on Wednesday. The incident occurred on Monday afternoon when a portion of the roof or the side wall of the mine collapsed. Among the dead, two were company officials while one was an outsourced worker.

209.title: Mumbai woman loses ₹20,000 while trying to order wine online
209.article_body: A 24-year-old Mumbai-based woman was duped of ₹20,406 by a cyber fraudster in a wine shop-cum-Google listing fraud. According to the complainant's statement, she had ordered wine from the 'Wine and Wine' shop after looking up their number on Google. A man received the call and sent her QR codes to make the payment after which the amount was deducted.

210.title: Chhattisgarh’s GSDP estimated to grow by 11.5%, says economic survey
210.article_body: Chhattisgarh's Gross State Domestic Product (GSDP) is estimated to grow by 11.54% and the per capita income by 11.93% in the financial year 2021-22, according to the economic survey presented by the state government in the Legislative Assembly on Tuesday. The survey report was presented by Planning, Economics and Statistics Minister Amarjeet Bhagat.

211.title: What are the major announcements made in Chhattisgarh Budget 2022-23?
211.article_body: In his Budget 2022-23 speech, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Wednesday announced that the old pension scheme will be restored. "₹2 crore proposed for Chhattisgarh Rojgar Mission to work on the possibilities of creating new jobs," Baghel added. Chhattisgarh government has increased the annual assistance under Rajiv Gandhi Bhumihin Krishi Majdur Nyay Yojana from ₹6,000 to ₹7,000 from next year.

212.title: Antarctic explorer's ship found 107 years after it sank
212.article_body: The wreck of Endurance, the lost ship of Antarctic explorer Sir Ernest Shackleton, was found at the weekend at the bottom of the Weddell Sea. The ship was crushed by sea-ice and sank in 1915, forcing Shackleton and his men to escape on foot and in small boats. Its name - Endurance - is clearly visible on the stern.

213.title: CM Baghel brings briefcase made of cow dung to present Chhattisgarh Budget, shares pic
213.article_body: Chattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel walked in the Chhattisgarh Assembly carrying a briefcase made of cow dung ahead of the state Budget. The briefcase had "Gomaye Vasate Lakshmi" written on it in Sanskrit, which translates to "Goddess of wealth Laxmi resides in cow dung". Chhattisgarh government had announced in 2020 that it'll procure cow dung from cow breeders and farmers.

214.title: IndiGo, SpiceJet shares jump as ban on international flights lifted after 2 years
214.article_body: Shares of Indian airlines, including SpiceJet, IndiGo parent InterGlobe Aviation and Jet Airways, rose 5-8% each, a day after the government lifted the ban on regular international flights after two years. The Centre will resume scheduled commercial international passenger flights to and from India from March 27. Currently, international flights operate under air bubble arrangements with nations.

215.title: Security measures in place at EVM strong room: Lucknow Police Commissioner
215.article_body: There are adequate security measures in place at EVM strong room, DK Thakur, Police Commissioner, Lucknow, said on Wednesday. "Strong room will be opened at around 7 am in the presence of election observers and candidates. Counting (of votes) will begin at 8 am tomorrow. Police patrolling will be done in sensitive areas," Thakur added.

216.title: Better.com accidentally sent severance cheques a day before mass layoffs: Report
216.article_body: US-based mortgage lending startup Better.com accidentally released severance payslips a day before mass layoffs were meant to be announced, TechCrunch reported citing employees. "No email, no call, nothing. This was handled disgustingly," an employee, who received a severance cheque, said. After the mistake, CFO Kevin Ryan sent an email to employees confirming the layoffs in US and India.

217.title: Not snorting drugs, leave if uncomfortable: Shweta on breastfeeding in public
217.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari said that as a mother, she enjoys breastfeeding and that if doing it in public makes anyone uncomfortable, they can "get up and go". "I'm not doing anything wrong. I'm not snorting drugs. I am feeding my hungry child," she said, adding, "It's such a taboo, airports don't have breastfeeding areas. They have smoking areas, though."

218.title: Alia in 'Gangubai...' in same league as Nargis in 'Mother India': Bhansali
218.article_body: Discussing actress Alia Bhatt's performance in his film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said he believes it is in the "same league" as late actress Nargis Dutt's performance in classic 'Mother India'. "[The] performance...will be celebrated for the next 50-100 years," added Bhansali. "It could be at par with...Meena Kumari in 'Sahib Bibi Aur Ghulam'," stated Bhansali.

219.title: I will give prize money for rest of 2022 to victims in Ukraine: Murray
219.article_body: Former world number one Andy Murray tweeted that he will be donating his earnings from prize money for the rest of 2022, to victims of the Russian invasion of Ukraine. "Over 7.5 million children are at risk with the escalating conflict in Ukraine," added Murray in his tweet. "It is vital [that] education continues," stated the tennis player.

220.title: Not really happy with my performance in Ranji, 40s and 50s are nothing: Shaw
220.article_body: Indian batter Prithvi Shaw, who's leading Mumbai in the Ranji Trophy 2022, has said he's not happy with his performance in the tournament. "It should have been much better. You know 40s and 50s are nothing in cricket," he stated. Shaw produced scores of 1, 9, 44 and 53 in his four innings in three Ranji games.

221.title: 2,078 UP students stranded in Ukraine evacuated: CM Yogi Adityanath
221.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that out of the total of 2,290 students from UP studying in Ukraine, 2,078 have been safely evacuated and have returned to their respective homes. He further informed that out of 74 students from Gorakhpur, 70 have safely returned. "The rest of the students are also being brought back safely," the CM added.

222.title: IIT grads-led Money View raises $75 mn at $625 mn valuation
222.article_body: Fintech platform Money View has raised $75 million in its Series D funding from Tiger Global, Winter Capital, Evolvence India and Accel, among others. The startup is now valued at $625 million. Founded in 2014 by IIT Delhi graduates, Puneet Agarwal and Sanjay Aggarwal, Money View provides personal loans, as well as buy-now-pay-later (BNPL) products to individuals.

223.title: Sensex jumps 1,100 points a day ahead of 5 state assembly election results
223.article_body: The Sensex jumped over 1,100 points during intraday trade on Wednesday ahead of the five state assembly election results tomorrow. While the Sensex was trading above 54,500 levels, the broader Nifty 50 jumped over 300 points to trade above 16,300 levels. Earlier, exit polls predicted that AAP may win in Punjab, while BJP will retain Uttar Pradesh.

224.title: 6 labourers from Bihar drugged, robbed on train in UP
224.article_body: Six labourers from Bihar who were travelling in Bihar-bound Jannayak Express train were allegedly drugged and robbed of their luggage and valuables at Bareilly junction in Uttar Pradesh. The labourers were found in an unconscious state in a coach by a passenger who informed Government Railway Police. They were rushed to the district hospital but they haven't regained consciousness yet.

225.title: BJP, RSS have nothing to do with Nathuram Godse: Gujarat minister
225.article_body: The BJP and RSS have nothing to do with Mahatma Gandhi's assassin Nathuram Godse, said Gujarat Cabinet Minister Purnesh Modi on Tuesday. "The Bharatiya Jana Sangh, RSS or BJP have never talked about it [association with Godse]. We have no relation with him," he said after Congress questioned the installation of Godse's bust in Jamnagar.

226.title: With 90.5% coverage, Odisha tops India's list of full immunisation
226.article_body: With 90.5% coverage, Odisha has topped the national level list of full immunisation, a senior health official confirmed on Tuesday. While 20 districts in the state have achieved above 90% full immunisation, the remaining 10 were below 90%. Full immunisation programmes refer to vaccination against 12 different diseases including polio, tuberculosis, jaundice, diphtheria and HIV among others.

227.title: Bottom line was 'Pak shouldn't lose': Shahid Afridi on Rawalpindi pitch
227.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi has criticised the Rawalpindi pitch used in the first Test against Australia, stating that the upcoming games should have "good pitches". "Pakistan didn't think about Australia, the bottom line was 'we shouldn't lose'," stated Afridi. Both the teams aggregated 1,187 runs for 14 wickets in the match, which ended in a draw.

228.title: 16-yr-old boy held for creating fake FB profile of Chengalpattu Collector
228.article_body: A 16-year-old boy in Rajasthan was held for allegedly creating a fake Facebook profile of Chengalpattu District Collector, AR Rahul Nadh. On January 18, Nadh had announced on Facebook that someone had created a fake account in his name and was asking for money from the public. Nadh asked people not to accept any friend request from the profile concerned.

229.title: High command, party MLAs will decide CM: Congress poll observer in U'khand
229.article_body: Ahead of the Uttarakhand Assembly poll results, Congress poll observer Mohan Prakash said the Chief Minister will be decided by party high command and elected MLAs. "We are sure of forming government in Uttarakhand, Goa, Punjab and getting majority...in UP," Prakash added. His remarks came after Congress leader Harish Rawat said nobody has objections to his name as CM candidate.

230.title: UP Board exams for Classes 10, 12 to start from March 24; to be held offline
230.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Madhyamik Shiksha Parishad (UPMSP) has released the state Board examinations schedule for Classes 10 and 12. Class 10 exams will be conducted between March 24-April 9, and Class 12 exams will be conducted between March 24-April 12. The exams will be conducted in two shifts, from 8 am to 11:15 am and from 2 pm to 5:15 pm.

231.title: 8-yr-old died on streets, 14-yr-old hit in the head by wreckage: Ukraine's 1st Lady
231.article_body: Condemning Russia's "mass murder" of civilians in an open letter to global media, First Lady of Ukraine, Olena Zelenska, wrote, "Eight-year-old Alice...died on streets of Okhtyrka while her grandfather tried to protect her." "14-year-old Arseniy was hit in the head by wreckage, and could not be saved because an ambulance could not get to him on time," she added.

232.title: UK announces new aviation sanctions giving it power to detain Russian aircraft
232.article_body: The UK has announced new aviation sanctions giving it the power to detain any Russian aircraft. It will also strengthen its ban on Russian aircraft, making it a criminal offence for any to fly or land in the UK. The ban includes any aircraft owned, operated or chartered by anyone connected with Russia or designated individuals or entities.

233.title: Gurugram woman accuses Bihar cricket chief of trying to rape her at 5-star hotel in Delhi
233.article_body: A woman from Gurugram, who is the director of an advertisement firm, has accused Bihar Cricket Association President Rakesh Tiwary of trying to rape her at a five-star hotel in Delhi last year. She alleged that Rakesh tried to force himself on her when she had gone to meet him over pending payments. Police have filed an FIR.

234.title: Hungary will not support ban on Russian energy imports: PM Orban
234.article_body: Hungarian PM Viktor Orban said that Hungary will not support a ban on Russian oil and gas imports, saying it "would represent a disproportionately large burden" for his country. "While we condemn Russia's armed offensive and we also condemn the war, we will not allow Hungarian families to be made to pay the price of the war," he said.

235.title: 10-year-old Ukrainian girl shot dead by drunk Russian soldiers, says family
235.article_body: A 10-year-old Ukrainian girl was shot dead by drunk Russian soldiers in front of her uncle in a village near Kyiv, her family said. Russian soldiers allegedly started shooting "everywhere they could see", including in four homes, after a Ukrainian boy fired a gun in the air. The family was later forced to bury her in the yard.

236.title: Better.com is laying off 3,000 India & US workers after firing 900 on a Zoom call
236.article_body: Mortgage lending startup Better.com, which had fired 900 employees on a Zoom call, has announced that it's reducing its workforce in India and the US in a significant manner over "the coming days". A company spokesperson told TechCrunch that the number is "just over 3,000". CFO Kevin Ryan said affected employees will be eligible for 60-80 days of severance pay.

237.title: AIIMS Delhi launches app with 'panic button' for women employees
237.article_body: The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Delhi has launched an "empowerment app" called the AIIMS ICC. It has reportedly been launched for women employees who feel unsafe in hospital. The app has panic button that can be used to send distress signal to hospital security team. "App can be used...as signal to initiate rescue for...female employees," release said.

238.title: 500 PCR vans deployed for women's safety: Delhi Police Commissioner
238.article_body: Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana on Tuesday said more than 500 PCR vans have been deployed near schools and colleges across the city to ensure the safety of women students. "Under our free ride scheme, distressed women are being dropped to their homes at night," the commissioner said in a podcast on the occasion of International Women's Day.

239.title: Heartened to see US ban Russian oil imports, UK must follow: Branson
239.article_body: Billionaire Richard Branson praised the US ban on Russian oil imports saying, "Heartened to see...US...ban the import of Russian oil and natural gas." "This will have an impact on remaining revenue flows to Russia," he added. Branson said UK and EU must enforce a ban too as complete economic isolation is the "only way of forcing Russia out of Ukraine".

240.title: No negativity for her: Varun Sood's dad reacts to son's breakup with Divya
240.article_body: Varun Sood's father Vineet Sood reacted to his son's breakup with Divya Agarwal and said that he respects Divya's decision. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "It's life. I have no negativity for her. She was and will continue to have my unfiltered affection and care. Cherish your times in togetherness and [we] wish her luck and God's speed in life."

241.title: Thanks for striking in heart of Putin's war machine: Zelenskyy to Biden
241.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy thanked US President Joe Biden for banning Russian oil, coal and gas from US markets in response to Moscow's ongoing invasion of Ukraine. Zelenskyy said the ban would "strike in the heart of [Russian President] Vladimir Putin's war machine". The Ukrainian President also urged other countries and leaders to do the same.

242.title: Defence Ministry seeks independent weapon testing-certification agency
242.article_body: In a move to promote 'Atmanirbharta', the Defence Ministry has approached the Union Cabinet to approve setting up of an independent body to meet testing and certification requirements of weapons developed by Indian private sector. The authority will work towards ensuring that private sector is not dependent on government for getting their equipment approved for both domestic sales and exports.

243.title: Had self doubt, was told 'mothers don't have flat stomach': Rupali on Anupamaa
243.article_body: Actress Rupali Ganguly said that she had self-doubts when she joined the show 'Anupamaa'. "I told our producer...let me lose some weight...[he] told me 'I want a mother and you are perfect for the role because mothers are like this. Mothers don't get time to hit gym and have perfect figure and have a flat stomach'," she added.

244.title: WI defend 9 runs in 48th over to defeat England by 7 runs in Women's WC
244.article_body: While defending nine runs, West Indies' Anisa Mohammed took a wicket and effected a run-out in the 48th over to help her team defeat England by seven runs in the ongoing ICC Women's ODI World Cup. This is West Indies' second straight victory in the tournament. WI posted 225/6 before restricting England to 218/10 in 47.4 overs.

245.title: We will make B'wood talk about us through our work: Tamil actor Suriya
245.article_body: Talking about whether he wishes to work in Bollywood, Tamil actor Suriya Sivakumar said, "We will make Bollywood talk about us [through our work]. I don't think we need to go there to prove ourselves." "If a guest comes..., we...ask our daughter to serve...and not our sons. Why does that happen? The change should start from ourselves," added Suriya.

246.title: Putin must see whole sporting world is disgusted: Ex-Ukrainian boxer Klitschko
246.article_body: Ukrainian boxing Hall of Famer Wladimir Klitschko praised the support shown by fans during Premier League matches, adding, "Please keep it going - Vladimir Putin...must see the whole sporting world is disgusted by his aggression." "Putin won't stop because of one gesture," he stated. "I have nothing personal against...[Russian] athletes but...a lot against [Putin's] aggression," said Wladimir.

247.title: Nobody thought I would be an actor: 'Baahubali' actor Prabhas
247.article_body: Actor Prabhas who played the titular character in the 'Baahubali' film franchise said "nobody" thought he would become an actor one day, adding that he has opened up having been "very shy" previously. "I got lucky with Baahubali. The pressure will always be there, suddenly a film from one state got such immense response from the whole...world," stated Prabhas.

248.title: People helped by Deol family took advantage, spoiled our names: Bobby
248.article_body: Terming the Deol family as "very simple and good", actor Bobby Deol said "many" people helped by them took their "advantage" and "spoiled" the family's name. "This keeps on happening. We aren't manipulative or street smart," added Bobby. "We were told since we were kids to be a nice human being," stated the actor.

249.title: Purnia becomes first Bihar district to launch menstrual hygiene plan
249.article_body: Purnia became the first district in Bihar to launch an action plan for menstruation hygiene management on Women's Day, officials said. The management plan first succeeded in the Kasba block, where it started as a pilot project in April 2021, Purnia DM Rahul Kumar said. NITI Aayog has also approved a proposal for toilets at 200 government schools in Purnia.

250.title: Get to bomb shelters as quickly as possible: Ukraine authorities to people in Kyiv
250.article_body: An air alert has been declared in and around the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv, with residents urged to get to bomb shelters as quickly as possible, Associated Press reported. "Threat of a missile attack," regional administration head Oleksiy Kuleba said on Telegram. Across the country, thousands of people are thought to have been killed in nearly two weeks of fighting.

251.title: We're sorry, we messed up: Flipkart on 'Get kitchen appliances' text on Women's Day
251.article_body: Flipkart has apologised after the e-commerce platform was criticised for sending a message promoting kitchen appliances on International Women's Day 2022. "Dear Customer, This Women's Day, let's celebrate You. Get Kitchen Appliances from ₹299," the message read. "We messed up and we're sorry. We did not intend to hurt anyone's sentiments," Flipkart wrote on its official Twitter account.

252.title: 60-year-old former IB officer allegedly rapes 17-year-old girl in Delhi hotel
252.article_body: Delhi Police are searching for a 60-year-old retired officer of the Intelligence Bureau (IB) who allegedly raped a 17-year-old girl at a hotel on Monday. Police said the accused knew the victim and her family and he had called the girl on the pretext of giving her a job. "He has switched off his phone and is absconding," police added.

253.title: Amazon-backed Rivian sued over misleading investors about EV prices
253.article_body: Amazon-backed Rivian has been sued in the US by a shareholder Charles Larry Crews who claimed it failed to tell investors it had underpriced its electric vehicles. Crews said Rivian hid that its R1S SUV and R1T pickup truck were so underpriced that it needed to raise prices soon after its November IPO. The lawsuit names more than 30 defendants.

254.title: Don't bring caste consideration in admission to military schools: SC
254.article_body: Rejecting a plea for caste reservations in admission to military schools, the Supreme Court said that India's armed forces are a "homogenous unit" that should not be divided on the basis of caste. "You cannot have caste reservation in military schools...We're focussed on gender issues and would not want you to divide it into other issues of caste," SC added.

255.title: Opinion polls & exit polls should be banned: Sukhbir Badal
255.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal on Wednesday said that opinion polls and exit polls should be banned. "I think no Punjabi believes the exit polls...EC monitors that voters aren't influenced but nowadays some governments get opinion polls conducted using public money. AAP has done this," Badal added.

256.title: 2,500 Meghalaya health workers opted not to get COVID vaccine: Health Minister
256.article_body: There are 2,505 healthcare workers in Meghalaya, mostly working in government health facilities, who have chosen not to get vaccinated against COVID-19, state Health Minister, James K Sangma said. The total number of unvaccinated health care workers in government hospitals is 2,456 while in private hospitals, only 49 have opted not to get vaccinated, Sangma added.

257.title: Always scores big in India: Gavaskar on Agarwal being preferred over Gill
257.article_body: Talking about India's decision to play Mayank Agarwal in KL Rahul's absence in the first Test against Sri Lanka, Sunil Gavaskar said Agarwal "bats like a boss" in home games and he should be preferred over Shubman Gill. Gavaskar added, "He (Gill) hasn't played any cricket in last two months...he has the talent, but, it's also about form."

258.title: Mumbai court recommends joint parenting in divorce cases
258.article_body: Citing a judgement of the Bombay High Court from January 2016, a family court in Mumbai issued a circular calling upon lawyers, judges, and marriage counsellors to explore the possibility of shared parenting in divorce cases. The High Court had earlier observed joint parenting should be the rule and single parenting an exception if both the parents are available.

259.title: UN human rights chief to visit China's Xinjiang in May
259.article_body: UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Michelle Bachelet has said she will visit Xinjiang province in China in May. She has been pressing for the visit to look into the reports of rights abuse of Uyghur Muslims in the region. "I am pleased to announce that we have recently reached an agreement with the government of China," said Bachelet.

260.title: Warne didn't discuss Eng coach role as I would've talked him out: Ponting
260.article_body: Talking about Shane Warne who passed away aged 52, Ricky Ponting said Warne didn't discuss potentially becoming England's head coach with him as he would have tried "talking him out of it" pretty quickly. "Having someone like Warne to take over the England cricket team, I think he would have done a terrific job," added Ponting.

261.title: Traffic police implements odd-even parking in Bandra, Khar
261.article_body: The traffic police department has implemented an odd-even parking system in Bandra and Khar areas of Mumbai to ease congestion. As per the system, parking is allowed on east side of road when the calendar date is even, while it is allowed on the west side when the date is odd. The system has been implemented on 13 roads.

262.title: Iran launches second military satellite Noor-2 into space: Report
262.article_body: Iran has launched its second military satellite Noor-2 into space, according to the state media. "Iran's second military satellite, named Noor-2, has been launched into space by the Qassed rocket of the aerospace wing of the Revolutionary Guards and successfully placed in orbit 500 kilometers above the Earth," said the report. The first Noor satellite was launched in April 2020.

263.title: Putin is angry: US spy chief warns Russia could 'double down' in Ukraine
263.article_body: The chief of American spy agency CIA, William Burns, warned of an "ugly next few weeks" in Ukraine. "I think Russian President Vladimir Putin is angry, frustrated right now. He's likely to double down and try to grind down...Ukrainian military with no regard for civilian casualties," Burns said. This is "a matter of deep personal conviction" for Putin, Burns added.

264.title: Women shouldn't confine to kitchen: Kerala's 1st female ambulance driver
264.article_body: Deepamol from Kottayam has become Kerala's first woman ambulance driver in the government sector. Deepamol said that women shouldn't confine themselves to kitchen and should have will to take up any job to gain financial independence. State Health Minister Veena George handed over the keys of 'KANIV-108' ambulance to 42-year-old Deepamol on the occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday.

265.title: She's at home: Saba to troll who asked 'Where's Amrita Singh' in her post
265.article_body: On Women's Day,  Saif Ali Khan's sister Saba Ali Khan dedicated a post to all the women members of her family including sister-in-law Kareena Kapoor. However, users pointed out that Saba had not included Saif's ex-wife and actress Amrita Singh in her post. Replying to a troll, who asked 'Where is Amrita', Saba wrote, "[She's] sleeping safely at home...I suppose."

266.title: Went for look test, couldn't recognise myself: Lara on playing Indira Gandhi
266.article_body: Actress Lara Dutta who played late Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in 'BellBottom' said she could not recognise herself when she went for look test. "I had to go close to mirror...look into my eyes...could see it was me...body language, understanding her state of mind, all that went into...being worked upon to get under skin...that was how...character was completed," she added.

267.title: Liquor law passed without any legislative study: SC to Bihar govt
267.article_body: The Supreme Court lashed out at the Bihar government over its liquor law and said that "this law is creating crowding". "Rectify it or release everybody on bail till rectification is done. You have passed the law without any legislative impact study," the court added. "Burden is on you (Bihar government) to correct the course," the bench further said.

268.title: Universal Music suspends operations, closes offices in Russia
268.article_body: Universal Music Group has said it is suspending all operations in Russia and closing its offices, amid the growing protest from global firms against the violence in Ukraine. "We are adhering to international sanctions and...have been working with groups from a range of countries...to support humanitarian relief efforts," it said. It also urged for an end to violence in Ukraine.

269.title: I'll remember that 12-km walk from Kharkiv carrying Indian flag: Ukraine-returned student
269.article_body: Shwetha Thirumalai Kumaraswamy, a first-year medical student in Ukraine who returned to India on Tuesday, has said, "I will remember that 12-km walk from Kharkiv railway station to Pisochyn carrying the Indian national flag when we were exposed to all kinds of threats." She added, "Shelling haunted us from Kharkiv to Romanian border...we comforted our parents by lying to them."

270.title: Why will cricketers not be allowed to apply saliva on ball?
270.article_body: As per new MCC laws, cricketers won't be allowed to apply saliva on ball from October 1. "MCC’s research found that this had little or no impact on the amount of swing the bowlers were getting," MCC said. It will also remove any grey areas of fielders eating sugary sweets to alter their saliva to apply to ball, MCC added.

271.title: LIC gets SEBI nod for India's biggest-ever IPO: Reports
271.article_body: State-run Life Insurance Corporation of India has reportedly received market regulator SEBI's approval for an initial public offering (IPO). The IPO is expected to be the country's biggest-ever public issue. According to its draft papers filed on February 13, LIC will offload 31.62 crore shares. Earlier, reports said the government may defer the IPO to next fiscal amid Russia-Ukraine war.

272.title: Hijacker of 1999 Indian Airlines flight shot dead in Pakistan: Reports
272.article_body: Mistry Zahoor Ibrahim, one of the hijackers of the IC-814 Indian Airlines flight from Kathmandu to Delhi in 1999, was shot dead in Pakistan's Karachi, according to reports. The Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorist was living under a false identity "Zahid Akhund" for many years. He was reportedly shot twice in the head by unidentified gunmen in Karachi's Akhtar Colony on March 1.

273.title: Ukraine's First Lady pens open letter, says 'We do not know how long the war will last'
273.article_body: Penning an open letter to global media, Ukraine's First Lady Olena Zelenska said, "We don't know how long [war with Russia] will last." She added, "If we don't stop [Vladimir] Putin, who threatens to start a nuclear war, there will be no safe place in the world for any of us." She further wrote, "We'll win. Because of our unity."

274.title: Court acquits Mumbai taxi driver on charges of disobeying woman police
274.article_body: A sessions court acquitted a Mumbai-based taxi driver from charges of disobeying a woman police personnel from discharging her duties. As per the complaint, the driver when stopped from driving in no-entry zone misbehaved with the police personnel. There is "absolutely nothing" in this evidence to show that he caused hindrance to police personnel in performing duty, the court said.

275.title: 1 Russian ruble now worth less than 1 American penny: US President Biden
275.article_body: While announcing a ban on imports of Russian oil and gas, US President Joe Biden said that the country's "most significant package of economic sanctions in history" has caused the Russian economy to "crater". "The Russian ruble is now down...by 50% since Putin announced his war. One ruble is now worth less than one American penny," he added.

276.title: We've lost contact with monitoring systems at Chernobyl plant: Nuclear watchdog
276.article_body: International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has said it has lost contact with remote data transmission from safeguards monitoring systems installed at Chernobyl nuclear power plant in northern Ukraine, which was taken over by Russian forces. The Chernobyl site is not currently operational and handling of nuclear material has been halted, the IAEA added. The facility holds decommissioned reactors.

277.title: Joining NATO now would destabilise northern Europe: Swedish PM
277.article_body: Swedish PM Magdalena Andersson has rejected opposition calls to consider joining NATO following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. An application now would "destabilise" northern Europe and "increase tensions", Andersson said. Last month, Russia had warned Sweden and Finland to not join the NATO military alliance, saying that the move "would have serious military and political consequences".

278.title: Anish Khan died while climbing down pipe to escape police: TMC MLA
278.article_body: Trinamool Congress MLA from Canning Purba, Saokat Molla, has claimed that student leader Anish Khan died when he was climbing down a pipe while trying to escape police. "When police reached his house, Anish tried to escape...but he fell off and died," he added. "Was Molla present there? I suggest SIT members question him," BJP's Dilip Ghosh remarked.

279.title: Russia violated ceasefire agreement in Ukraine for third straight day: UK
279.article_body: Russia violated ceasefire agreement to allow humanitarian corridors in Ukraine for the third straight day, claimed UK's defence ministry. "Russian forces have reportedly disrupted the humanitarian corridors in Mariupol and Sumy," said UK. "Shelling and small-arms fire were reported throughout the day although it's likely that some civilians have been able to flee the besieged cities," it added.

280.title: Lord Krishna came to my dream, said CM Yogi will form govt in UP: BJP MP
280.article_body: After the exit polls predicted BJP's return to power in UP, Rajya Sabha MP Harnath Singh Yadav on Tuesday said that the predictions are true. Yadav added that Lord Krishna came to his dream and told him that CM Yogi Adityanath will form government in the state. "The exit polls are not random," Yadav stated.

281.title: US charges 2 siblings in $124 million crypto fraud operation
281.article_body: The US SEC has charged two siblings, John and JonAtina Barksdale, accusing them of defrauding retail investors out of more than $124 million with a digital token known as Ormeus Coin. Since 2017, the accused had allegedly raised $124 million from over 20,000 investors. They promoted Ormeus Coin through roadshows and social media, as well as a Times Square jumbotron.

282.title: Will ensure conflict doesn’t spread beyond Ukraine: NATO
282.article_body: NATO said it will ensure the Russia-Ukraine conflict doesn't spread to other countries. "We have a responsibility to ensure the conflict does not escalate and spread beyond Ukraine," NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg said. "We will protect and defend every inch of all allied territory," he added. Meanwhile, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said he will no longer press for NATO membership.

283.title: We have to be patient: GT's Director of Cricket on Pandya's fitness
283.article_body: Gujarat Titans' Director of Cricket Vikram Solanki has said their captain Hardik Pandya is on his path to recovery and playing a full part but they have to be patient with the demands. "Hardik is working extremely hard in all aspects of his game...He's conscious that he has to get up to speed with batting, bowling and fielding," added Vikram.

284.title: Told him not to assume I'd do anything for him: Sham on Vicky joining B'wood
284.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal's father Sham Kaushal, who's a renowned action director in Bollywood, recalled how he couldn't refuse Vicky when he said he wanted to join the films soon after clearing his engineering course. Sham said he explained to Vicky that he shouldn't assume his father would do anything for him, in fact, he had to earn his position.

285.title: WB Speaker rejects Governor's request to meet over ruckus in Assembly
285.article_body: West Bengal Assembly Speaker Biman Banerjee rejected Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar's request to meet over ruckus in the Assembly. "Urged Speaker for a meeting...in view of 'unseemly ruckus and chaotic spectacle unfolded in the hallowed precincts of the Assembly on March 7'," Dhankhar tweeted. The Speaker rejected the request saying he was preoccupied due to the ongoing Assembly session, ANI reported.

286.title: Delhi cabinet gives approval for restructuring, strengthening DDC
286.article_body: The Delhi government has approved the proposal for restructuring and strengthening its policy think tank, the Dialogue and Development Commission (DDC), its Vice-Chairperson Jasmine Shah said on Tuesday. The commission will now have 48 sanctioned posts. Out of these, 26 policy makers from several domains from across the world will be employed on a contractual basis, Shah added.

287.title: People come to watch so-called good-looking stars in glossy films: Tandav actor
287.article_body: 'Tandav' actor Mohd Zeeshan Ayyub said it's unfortunate that good actors aren't getting good roles. He added, "If it's a glossy film selling dream, then...people come to watch the so-called good-looking stars." "It's also a part of our conditioning that only fair people look good," Ayyub said. He further added that things are changing now because of OTT.

288.title: GSK and MS Dhoni team up for 6 in 1 vaccination awareness campaign
288.article_body: GSK launches a new public interest campaign featuring MS Dhoni, to raise awareness about the need for prevention of 6 diseases with just 1 vaccination. The awareness film, featuring Dhoni, draws parallel between hitting a six in cricket and '6 in 1' vaccination for infants. The campaign's tagline, 'Less injections, less pain' encapsulates the key benefits of this combination vaccination.

289.title: Everyone said I should lose some weight after my 1st Kannada film: Meghana Raj
289.article_body: Actress Meghana Raj said that everybody started telling her to "lose some weight" after her first Kannada film. "But the Malayalam industry had accepted me exactly the way I was...in 'Beautiful'...my skin was really bad...I had weight issues...my director [told me] 'I do not want you to put makeup'." Meghana said that she often felt something was wrong with her.

290.title: Man poses as police officer, extorts money from spas in Pune; held
290.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Police arrested 28-year-old real estate agent, Vishal Jaunjale, for allegedly posing as a police officer and extorting money from spas and massage parlours by claiming he had recorded videos on premises. Jaunjale was asking for ₹1 lakh after allegedly shooting video at spa. Police got spa owner to arrange a meeting with him at a restaurant and caught him.

291.title: 3 constables injured as explosives explode while defusing in Raigad
291.article_body: Two police constables of the Bomb Detection and Disposal Squad (BDDS) were seriously injured while another suffered minor injuries after explosives that were being disposed of suddenly exploded. The incident occurred on Tuesday in Maharashtra's Raigad district. "The BDDS team was disposing of explosives recovered in a case of 2013. The explosives included gelatin and detonators," an official said.

292.title: Russia's rating cut for 2nd time in a week by Fitch
292.article_body: Russia's sovereign rating has been downgraded by six notches to the second lowest level of 'C' by Fitch Ratings, which said that a bond default is "imminent". "This rating action follows our downgrade...to 'B'/Rating Watch Negative on 2 March," it said. "Developments since then have...further undermined Russia's willingness to service government debt," the rating agency added amid sanctions.

293.title: India reports 4,575 new COVID-19 cases, 14.5% higher than yesterday
293.article_body: India has reported 4,575 new COVID-19 cases and 145 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,993 cases and 108 deaths. Out of the 145 deaths, 45 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 100 were reconciled deaths in Kerala.

294.title: India's 1st women-owned industrial park opens in Hyderabad
294.article_body: India's first 100% women-owned industrial park called FLO Industrial Park began operations in Hyderabad's Sultanpur on Tuesday. "The park promoted by FICCI Ladies Organization (FLO) in partnership with Telangana government, has announced the commencement of operations," Telangana IT and Industries Minister KT Rama Rao said. The park has been set up in 50 acres with an investment of ₹250 crore.

295.title: 'Mankading' no longer 'unfair play' as cricket laws amended
295.article_body: In MCC's 'The Laws of Cricket 2017 Code (3rd Edition - 2022)', 'mankading' has been moved from Law 41 (Unfair play) to Law 38 (Run-out). MCC said that the wording of the law will remain the same. 'Mankad' is a rare form of dismissal wherein a bowler runs out non-striker after the latter leaves crease even before ball is delivered.

296.title: Liverpool reach Champions League quarters with 2-1 aggregate win vs Inter
296.article_body: Liverpool suffered 0-1 defeat to Inter Milan in the Champions League last-16 second leg but advanced to the quarterfinals with a 2-1 aggregate in the tie. Lautaro Martinez put Inter ahead in the 61st minute but they were reduced to 10 men after Alexis Sanchez was sent off moments later. This was Liverpool's first defeat in the competition this season.

297.title: 32-year-old carpenter in Pune robbed by 2 men posing as customers
297.article_body: A 32-year-old carpenter was allegedly robbed by two men who claimed to be customers and called him to a secluded spot on the pretext of giving him work, police said. When the victim reached the location, the accused allegedly threatened to kill him and robbed him of ₹5,000 cash, and also forced him to transfer ₹42,800 using various UPI-based e-wallets.

298.title: I've done my best to lead NSE in a difficult period: CEO on not seeking 2nd term
298.article_body: National Stock Exchange (NSE) MD & CEO Vikram Limaye said that he won't apply for a second term as his first five-year term ends in July 2022. "I've done my best to lead the organisation in a very difficult period and to stabilise, strengthen and transform NSE," he added. Earlier, NSE published an advertisement calling for candidates for CEO role.

299.title: Exit polls of Punjab are far from reality: Congress' Harish Rawat
299.article_body: As exit polls predicted that AAP will be getting the majority in Punjab Assembly polls, Congress leader Harish Rawat said that the exit polls are far from reality. "How would AAP get votes where it never exists? Congress is coming with a good mandate. I have full faith that we will form our government there (Punjab)," Rawat added.

300.title: Robert Vadra under-reported ₹106 cr income over 11 years: I-T Department
300.article_body: Businessman and husband of Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, Robert Vadra, under-reported his income from benami properties by ₹106 crore over 11 years from assessment years 2010-11 to 2020-21, claimed the Income Tax Department. The Department further alleged that seven companies owned by him also under-reported income by about ₹9 crore over assessment years 2010-11 to 2015-16.

301.title: Under PM Modi, India more likely to respond to Pak provocations: US Intelligence
301.article_body: Under Prime Minister Narendra Modi, India is more likely than in the past to respond with military force to any real or perceived Pakistani provocations, the US Intelligence Community has told the US Congress. "Pakistan has a long history of supporting anti-India militant groups...and each side's perception of heightened tensions raises the risk of conflict," it said.

302.title: Congress deploys senior leaders in Uttarakhand ahead of poll results
302.article_body: Ahead of the counting of votes in Uttarakhand, the AICC on Tuesday deployed senior Congress leaders in 13 districts of the state in order to coordinate with the party candidates. The party has sent senior leaders including party MPs, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel and AICC office-bearers. Other leaders include Congress MP Deepender Singh Hooda, AICC observer Mohan Prakash among others.

303.title: Amazon cloud unit stops taking new customers in Russia, Belarus
303.article_body: Amazon's cloud-computing unit AWS is no longer accepting new sign-ups based in Russia or Belarus, the firm announced. Amazon said the AWS unit had "no data centers, infrastructure or offices in Russia, and we have a long-standing policy of not doing business with the Russian government". AWS' biggest customers in Russia are companies with headquarters outside of the country.

304.title: Action to be taken against firms not prioritising locals: K'taka minister
304.article_body: Karnataka minister Murugesh R Nirani said action will be taken against companies if they fail to prioritise jobs for Kannadigas or those native to the southern state. "As per a clause in the 2020-25 Industrial Policy, the individual units must provide 100% jobs in D group and 70% of total jobs to Kannadigas," Nirani said in the legislative council.

305.title: K'taka govt launches programme to provide 5 lakh jobs to women till 2026
305.article_body: Karnataka government launched Women@Work (W@W) programme on Tuesday with an aim to provide five lakh jobs to women till 2026. The initiative which would contribute to the country's GDP growth is a part of Karnataka's Digital Economy Mission. Women will also be given free certificate courses as a part of this programme to train them technically in various disciplines.

306.title: Russia announces ceasefire in Ukraine for Wednesday morning
306.article_body: Russia has announced a humanitarian ceasefire in Ukraine starting at 10 am Moscow time on Wednesday for the evacuation of civilians. Russia has declared a 'regime of silence' and is reportedly ready to provide humanitarian corridors from a number of cities including Kyiv, Chernihiv, Sumy, Kharkiv, Mariupol, and Zaporizhzhia. On Tuesday, civilian evacuations took place from Sumy.

307.title: Chandigarh Police launches women patrol vehicles on Women's Day
307.article_body: On the occasion of International Women's Day, Chandigarh Police launched women patrolling vehicles in the city. The patrol vehicles were flagged off during a cultural-cum-educative programme at the Government College for Girls in Sector 42, on Tuesday. The cyber interns of Chandigarh Police also spread awareness about cyber security for women during the programme.

308.title: TN farmer ends life after firm seizes tractor for loan default
308.article_body: A 23-year-old farmer from Tamil Nadu's Viluppuram district died allegedly by suicide after agents of a private finance company seized one of his tractors and insulted him and his family for defaulting a loan. Police have registered a case against two employees of the firm. "The family wants monetary compensation, a loan waiver and return of tractor," said an official.

309.title: Lewandowski's 11-minute hat-trick help Bayern advance in Champions League
309.article_body: Robert Lewandowski scored three times in 11 minutes as Bayern Munich advanced to the Champions League quarterfinals with a 7-1 win over FC Salzburg. The German club won the last-16 tie 8-2 on aggregate after a 1-1 draw in Salzburg last month. Notably, Lewandowski's hat-trick inside 23 minutes from kick-off was the fastest in Champions League history.

310.title: EVMs were for training: EC after Akhilesh claims machines 'stolen' in Varanasi
310.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) has issued a statement after Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday alleged that EVMs were being stolen in Varanasi. "In the investigation, it has been found that these EVMs were marked for training," the CEO said. EVMs were being transported to train the officials involved in counting duty, the CEO added.

311.title: I wasn't willing to do 'Kahaani'; had no idea it'll be a hit: Nawazuddin
311.article_body: Nawazuddin Siddiqui said he's proud he did 'Kahaani' as the film changed his career. He added initially, he didn't have any idea that the film will be a hit. "Actually, I wasn't [willing to do] 'Kahaani'," he said. "Sujoy (director) called...and...set up a meeting at a restaurant...where he showed me a documentary, following which I got interested," he added.

312.title: SP leader Azam Khan gets bail in defamation case, to stay in jail
312.article_body: The Allahabad High Court has granted bail to Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan in a defamation case lodged against him in 2019. "The complainant has alleged that Azam Khan had attempted to disrupt the image of cleric Maulana Kalbe Jawad by issuing false statements," said Khan's lawyer. Khan, who has been booked in multiple cases, will remain in jail.

313.title: 2 post offices in Pune declared 'all-women' on International Women's Day
313.article_body: In a first for Pune, two post offices in city, Pune Cantonment (east) and Dr BA chowk, were declared women post offices on occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday. Four women staffers each will manage all postal operations at post offices. "This initiative aims at offering more ease for women customers to interact with women staffers," an official said.

314.title: After McDonald's, Coca-Cola, Pepsi & Starbucks suspend business in Russia
314.article_body: After McDonald's announced that it's temporarily shutting around 850 restaurants in Russia, Starbucks, Coca-Cola, PepsiCo and General Electric have suspended operations in the country. However, PepsiCo will continue to sell essentials like milk and baby food. Cereal manufacturer Kellogg's, KFC parent Yum Brands and Kraft Heinz are suspending their investment into Russia amid Ukraine invasion.

315.title: Pakistan national thanks Indian embassy and PM Modi for rescuing her in Ukraine
315.article_body: A video has surfaced online which shows a Pakistan woman named Asma Shafique thanking the Indian embassy in Kyiv and Prime Minister Narendra Modi for rescuing her "from a difficult situation" in war-torn Ukraine. She was rescued by the Indian authorities and is on her way to Western Ukraine for evacuation out of the country, ANI reported.

316.title: What are the new rules of cricket announced by MCC?
316.article_body: As per new cricket laws announced by MCC, cricketers won't be allowed to use saliva on ball. 'Mankading' has been removed from 'unfair play' section to 'run-out'. New batters will face next delivery after a player is given out caught even if batters have crossed before catch is taken. Wides will be judged based on where batters are standing.

317.title: 3 wanted in 14 cases of house thefts arrested in B'luru; 1.12 kg gold seized
317.article_body: The Nandini Layout Police have arrested three habitual offenders wanted in 14 cases of house break-ins and thefts in Bengaluru. A total of 1.12 kg of gold ornaments and 1.96 kg of silver articles worth ₹55.18 lakh have been seized from the accused, Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant said. Pant also announced a reward of ₹40,000 for the police team.

318.title: Oldest known ancestor of vampire squids, octopuses named after Biden
318.article_body: Researchers have identified the oldest known ancestor of vampyropods and named it after US President Joe Biden. 'Syllipsimopodi bideni' had 10 arms, fins, and rows of suckers to grasp prey. It lived 328 million years ago and represents a new species of vampyropods, the group of marine animals that includes vampire squids and octopuses.

319.title: Ukraine will never be a victory for Putin: US President Biden
319.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said the war in Ukraine would never be a victory for his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin. He said Putin may be able to take a city, but will never be able to hold the country. Biden announced a ban on US import of Russian oil, gas and energy in response to Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.

320.title: Mumbai to get its first air-conditioned unisex salon inside rail premises
320.article_body: Mumbai will get its first air-conditioned unisex salon-cum-spa corner inside rail premises at Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus. "This is certainly an interesting idea that we are exploring at CSMT and other stations as well. The one at CSMT is expected to be opened in 2-3 months," a CR official said. Facilities like massage, shaving, hair cutting will be provided here.

321.title: 5 students kidnap Class 12 boy over free passes for party in Gurugram
321.article_body: Police booked five students for allegedly kidnapping and assaulting a Class 12 boy after he refused them free passes for a party in Gurugram's Sector 29. Four suspects are students of Class 12 and one is a first-year student of law, police said. The accused met the victim at a mall and took him to a deserted place, police added.

322.title: Woman kills relative who assaulted her, semi-decomposed body found in Delhi
322.article_body: A 44-year-old woman, her son and his friend were arrested for allegedly thrashing her 35-year-old relative to death in Delhi. The man, Jaipal, was murdered after woman allegedly faced humiliation as he assaulted her, made video and sent it to her, her son and at least two relatives. Police said Jaipal's nude and semi decomposed body was found in flat.

323.title: Apple unveils Studio Display, Mac Studio starting from ₹1,59,900 & ₹1,89,900
323.article_body: Apple has launched a 27-inch Studio Display along with a Mac Studio featuring the new M1 Ultra and the M1 Max processor. The Studio Display sports a 5K Retina display, a 12-MP ultrawide camera, three USB-C ports and starts at ₹1,59,900. Apple's new display-less desktop computer, Mac Studio, includes USB-C ports and an SD card slot and starts at ₹1,89,900.

324.title: McDonald's temporarily shuts Russian restaurants, says 'can't ignore suffering in Ukraine'
324.article_body: McDonald's has announced it is temporarily closing all of its 850 restaurants in Russia, saying, "Our values mean we cannot ignore the needless human suffering unfolding in Ukraine." CEO Chris Kempczinski said the company will continue paying its 62,000 employees in Russia, adding, "At this juncture, it's impossible to predict when we might be able to reopen our restaurants."

325.title: Apple introduces 2 new colours for iPhone 13 lineup
325.article_body: Apple has announced two new colours for iPhone 13 Pro and iPhone 13, alpine green and green. "These new colours give customers even more options when choosing their iPhone, and we can't wait for them to take advantage of all the iPhone 13 lineup offers," said Bob Borchers, Apple's vice president of Worldwide Product Marketing.

326.title: Apple unveils iPad Air with M1 chip and 5G connectivity starting at ₹54,900
326.article_body: Apple today unveiled the new iPad Air with faster M1 processor starting at ₹54,900. The iPad Air comes with 5G connectivity, an upgraded 12MP front-facing camera with a wide angle lens, a faster USB-C port, and support for Apple's Smart Keyboard Folio and Magic Keyboard. It will be available in five colours with 64GB and 256GB storage options.

327.title: Apple launches new iPhone SE with 5G connectivity at a starting price of ₹43,900
327.article_body: Apple today announced the third-generation iPhone SE with 5G connectivity, a 4.7-inch Retina HD display, Touch ID and a single rear camera of 12 MP. Powered by Apple-designed A15 Bionic chip, it will be available in 64GB, 128GB and 256GB models in Midnight, Starlight and (Product) Red at a starting price of ₹43,900.

328.title: Help end sexual violence: Yami Gautam on International Women's Day
328.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam wrote an open letter on International Women's Day and made a "humble appeal" to "help end sexual violence". The 33-year-old, who was recently seen in the movie 'A Thursday' took to Instagram to share the letter. She said a character in the movie made her see the mental trauma, stigma and agony victims go through.

329.title: Tahira Kashyap celebrates Women's Day with her kids, shares video
329.article_body: Author-filmmaker Tahira Kashyap Khurrana celebrated Women's Day with her children, Virajveer Khurrana and Varushka Khurrana in London. She took to Instagram to share a video featuring pictures and clips with her children and wrote, "Celebrating this day, this life with my favs! They bring out the best in me." The trio reportedly reached London recently to meet Ayushmann Khurranna.

330.title: Didn’t deserve Filmfare award for Prem Aggan, says actor Fardeen Khan
330.article_body: Actor Fardeen Khan in a recent interview said that he "definitely didn't" deserve the Filmfare Award for Best Debut Actor for his 1998 film 'Prem Aggan'. The 48-year-old further revealed that despite receiving the award, he got negative reviews for his performance. "The film didn't work...I had no work...films I'd signed before that, people took their money back," he added.

331.title: Everyday is women's day: Kareena Kapoor Khan pens note on Instagram
331.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan on the occasion of International Women's Day, penned an inspiring note on social media to share with her fans. She took to Instagram and wrote, "Every day is women's day...Pride, love, equality, respect." She also shared a collage with pictures of Soha Ali Khan, Sharmila Tagore and Saba Pataudi which read, "Proud to be a woman."

332.title: No longer insisting on NATO membership, says Ukraine
332.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said he's no longer pressing for NATO membership for Ukraine, an issue that was one of Russia's stated reasons for invasion. "I've cooled down regarding this question a long time ago after we understood NATO isn't prepared to accept Ukraine," he stated. "The alliance is afraid of controversial things, and confrontation with Russia," the President added.

333.title: How does the World Test Championship points table read after 1st Pakistan-Australia Test?
333.article_body: After the first Pakistan-Australia Test ended in a draw, Australia are on top of the World Test Championship (WTC) points table with 77.77% of points won. Pakistan are second on the points table with 66.66% of points won. England are last on the table with 9.25% of points won, while India are fifth with 54.16% of points won.

334.title: PL suspends agreement with Russian broadcast partner over Ukraine war
334.article_body: Premier League on Tuesday suspended its agreement with Russian broadcast partner Okko Sport over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The Premier League said that it had unanimously agreed the suspension with all 20 Premier League clubs. The league added it will donate £1 million to the Disasters Emergency Committee "to deliver humanitarian aid directly to those in need".

335.title: Queen Elizabeth meets Trudeau in 1st meeting since getting COVID-19
335.article_body: Queen Elizabeth on Monday met Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau in her first official in-person meeting since testing positive for COVID-19 on February 20. The queen suffered mild cold-like symptoms at the time, cancelling several meetings while continuing to carry out light duties. Trudeau is in Britain to talk with Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

336.title: Don't agree with exit polls, they create mental pressure: RLD chief
336.article_body: Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) president Jayant Chaudhary on Tuesday said that he doesn't agree with the view presented by exit polls and that they create mental pressure. "There is a process for exit polls. No exit poll person was seen at the polling booths. I do not know from where they got the data," he said.

337.title: Defending freedom is going to cost Americans: Biden as US bans Russian oil imports
337.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Tuesday, while banning imports of Russian oil, called the move a "powerful blow" to "Putin's war". He further said that "defending freedom is going to cost". "It's going to cost us as well in the United States. Republicans and Democrats understand that alike. Republicans and Democrats alike are clear we must do this," Biden stated.

338.title: West Bengal cabinet gets new finance minister after reallocation
338.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee effected a minor reallocation in the cabinet and gave Chandrima Bhattacharya independent charge of the finance department with the rank of minister of state. Calling the elevation the best gift for state's women on Women's Day, Bhattacharya said, "I...will carry out the responsibilities entrusted to me till my last breath."

339.title: Majithia's judicial custody in drug case extended till March 22
339.article_body: Mohali District Court on Tuesday extended Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) leader Bikram Singh Majithia's judicial custody in a drug smuggling probe till March 22. He had been earlier remanded to judicial custody till March 8 after being booked under relevant sections of Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act in December. Majithia contested Punjab Assembly polls from Amritsar East seat.

340.title: 2 arrested over Srinagar grenade attack which killed 2, injured many
340.article_body: Two people have been arrested in connection with a grenade attack in J&K's Srinagar, which killed two and injured over 35 people. The Special Investigation Team (SIT) was able to identify the two accused and they were named as Mohammad Bariq and Fazil Nabi Sofi. Police said the accused committed the attack on direction of active terrorists in Kashmir Valley.

341.title: Romania to lift all COVID-19 restrictions from March 9
341.article_body: Romania's Health Minister Alexandru Rafila on Tuesday said the country will lift all COVID-19 restrictions from March 9, including an obligation to wear masks both indoors and outdoors. Romania is the European Union's second-least vaccinated country with under 42% of the population fully vaccinated. Measures like capacity limits on restaurants and events along with curfews on shops will be lifted.

342.title: Navalny urges Russians to protest Putin's 'hideous war' in Ukraine
342.article_body: Jailed Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny has urged Russians to oppose Vladimir Putin's "hideous war that he has waged against Ukraine". Navalny said, "The...anti-war protests should not be halted under any circumstances." Reportedly, more than 13,500 citizens across Russia have so far been detained since February 24 for protesting against the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

343.title: 31-year-old woman loses palm while segregating garbage in Pune
343.article_body: A woman lost her palm while segregating garbage at a residential society in Pune. Laxmi Shinde, who is a mother of three children, said, "Even today when the world is celebrating women's day, I and my family have no reason to celebrate." The 31-year-old further said that she and her family "hardly have any money" to keep themselves going.

344.title: Man held in Guj for cheating a man on pretext of online share trading
344.article_body: A man has been arrested from Gujarat for allegedly cheating a person of ₹7 lakh on the pretext of investing the amount in the online share market. A police official said the accused, 51-year-old Ramabhai Patel, allegedly cheated Himanshu Sharma, from MP's Jabalpur, by luring him with investment in the share market and opening a demat account for online trading.

345.title: Bride protests outside groom's Raj home as he doesn't show up at wedding
345.article_body: A bride in Rajasthan's Bharatpur district staged a dharna outside the groom's home after he didn't show up at their wedding scheduled on March 4. The groom's father has been arrested on the basis of a complaint filed by her father. The groom, who is in the Army, is admitted to a military hospital in Mathura, police said.

346.title: Seeing irresponsible comments on Indian envoy's death, treat it with decency: Govt
346.article_body: After India's envoy to Palestine Mukul Arya was found dead inside the embassy in Ramallah, the External Affairs Ministry said, "We've seen some irresponsible comments on passing away of Mukul Arya...He died of natural causes."
