The MEA further urged the "young diplomat be treated with decency and respect". This comes after AAP's Sanjay Singh claimed Arya died in "suspicious condition".

347.title: Ranveer & I talk about how staying grounded is important: Deepika
347.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone has said that staying grounded is the most important thing for her. "Ranveer [Singh] and I talk about this often...how anyone can be successful, but what matters more is to be remembered as a good human being," Deepika stated. Deepika added simple things like waking up next to her husband, having breakfast with family make her happy.

348.title: It almost felt surreal to travel after two years: Rasika Dugal
348.article_body: Actress Rasika Dugal has said that she felt surreal to travel outside India after two years for the shooting of her upcoming film 'Lord Curzon Ki Haveli'. Rasika stated that she was initially nervous because of COVID-19. "But once we were there and everyone in the unit had tested negative, I was so much more relaxed," she added.

349.title: Latvian politician joins forces in Ukraine to fight against Russia
349.article_body: Latvian politician Juris Jurašs has joined the fight against Russia in Ukraine, his party confirmed on Tuesday. It was Jurašs' "personal decision" to fight alongside Ukrainian soldiers, Latvian Justice Minister Jānis Bordāns said without revealing more information citing safety concerns. Last week, the Ukrainian President said that around 16,000 foreigners had volunteered to fight for Ukraine.

350.title: He helped me a lot: Alexander Zverev on 'role model' Roger Federer
350.article_body: World number three Alexander Zverev said former world number one and 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer was a "role model" for him when he was younger and was starting out on the ATP Tour. "We had a lot of conversations at a younger age and I think he helped me a lot in that regard," he said.

351.title: He is a worker, a fighter & has a great mentality: Paula Badosa on Nadal
351.article_body: World number seven Paula Badosa said Rafael Nadal is "a worker, a fighter and has a great mentality". Nadal won his 21st Grand Slam title at the Australian Open in January. "He has always been an example that I have looked at when I have faced difficult moments and if I want to emulate someone, it is Nadal," Badosa said.

352.title: US bans Russian oil imports over Ukraine war
352.article_body: US President Joe Biden has decided to ban Russian oil imports, he said during a live address as he announced actions to continue to hold Russia accountable over invasion of Ukraine. "We're banning all imports of Russian oil and gas and energy. That means Russian oil will no longer be accepted at US ports," he stated.

353.title: Mbappe doubtful for PSG's UCL game against Real Madrid, Ramos ruled out
353.article_body: Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) on Monday said Kylian Mbappe is doubtful for their Champions League Round of 16 second-leg tie against Real Madrid on Wednesday, while former Real Madrid defender Sergio Ramos has been ruled out. PSG said Mbappe sustained a knock on his right foot during training, with a further medical update to be given in the next 24 hours.

354.title: Australia's Labuschagne shares posters made by Pakistani fans, says 'Great to see'
354.article_body: Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne took to Instagram to share pictures of posters made by Pakistani fans for the first Test between Australia and Pakistan. "It's been great to see all the signs in the crowd at Rawalpindi feeling very welcome," he wrote. One of the posters read, "Hey Marnus! How do I pronounce your last name?"

355.title: My son's good looks can't guarantee his success in B'wood: Bobby Deol
355.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol has said that his son Aryaman Deol's good looks cannot guarantee his success in Bollywood. "His good looks are a plus point...but there's no guarantee about what's gonna happen in this industry," Bobby said. He cited his example and said, "People used to say the same things to me...But I know the reality."

356.title: Former world no. 3 Dominic Thiem pulls out of Indian Wells, Miami
356.article_body: Former world number three Dominic Thiem on Monday said he was pulling out of the ATP Masters 1000 events in Indian Wells and Miami due to a wrist injury. Thiem suffered a wrist injury in the Mallorca Open in 2021 and has not played since. Thiem added he hopes to return when the clay court season begins in April.

357.title: Police recover 22 pressure bombs, 16 grenades, weapons in Assam
357.article_body: The police have recovered 22 pressure bombs along with 22 detonator caps, 16 HE36 grenades, two UZI rifles with four magazines and one silencer from Mahamaya and Guma reserve forest areas in Assam. The weapons were hidden underground and police suspect that the recovered weapons belong to the former National Democratic Front of Bodoland (NDFB) militants.

358.title: Shaktimaan has all kinds of powers, can do everything: Mukesh Khanna
358.article_body: Actor Mukesh Khanna has said, "If you compare with the powers of any superhero, maybe Iron Man, Spider-Man or Superman...Shaktimaan can do everything." He added that 'Shaktimaan' has all kinds of powers because he's made from five elements of the universe. Mukesh Khanna added that the upcoming film 'Shaktimaan' will be a trilogy.

359.title: Kane scores 176th PL goal, overtakes Henry in all-time PL scoring list
359.article_body: Tottenham Hotspur's Harry Kane on Monday scored his 176th Premier League goal, overtaking former Arsenal striker Thierry Henry's tally of 175. Kane is now sixth on the all-time Premier League scoring list. "Thierry was one of the greatest strikers we have seen, so it's nice to go above him in the scorers list and hopefully they keep coming," Kane said.

360.title: Toothbrush pierces woman's cheek & gets stuck after she falls, removed post surgery in TN
360.article_body: A 34-year-old Tamil Nadu woman had to go through surgery after a plastic toothbrush was stuck inside her cheek when she slipped and fell in her bathroom while brushing. Ekamai Revathi fell sideways, which led to the brush piercing through her cheek. It was stuck in a manner that she couldn't open or close her mouth or scream for help.

361.title: Western nations didn’t save our cities, although they can: Ukraine Prez
361.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has blamed the West for not saving Ukraine's cities and civilians from Russian bombs, although they can. He said, "While Russians are to blame for...killings, responsibility is shared by those who for 13 days in their Western offices haven't been able to approve...necessary decision." He has demanded Western powers to enforce a no-fly zone over Ukraine.

362.title: 5 teens rape 2 minor girls in Bihar after watching porn on phone
362.article_body: 5 teenage boys allegedly gang-raped 2 minor girls on Monday evening in Barbigha police station area in Bihar, police said on Tuesday. The survivor's family caught two of the accused and handed them over to the police. During the investigation, the boys allegedly admitted that they committed the crime after watching porn videos on a smartphone.

363.title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal honours transgender activist Gauri Sawant
363.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday honoured Gauri Sawant, a transgender activist from Mumbai who has been helping transgender people. Sawant's petition in the Supreme Court helped in the recognition of transgender as the third gender. Kejriwal also lauded the Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) for instilling a sense of security among women in the national capital.

364.title: DCW has instilled sense of security among women of Delhi: Kejriwal
364.article_body: Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday hailed the Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) for its work, saying it has instilled a sense of security among women in the capital. While speaking at the International Women's Day Awards function hosted by the DCW, Kejriwal said that the women know they can contact 181 (DCW helpline) if they face any injustice.

365.title: Paraglider loses balance in Himachal, tourist & helper killed
365.article_body: A tourist and a helper died, while a pilot was injured in a paragliding accident in Himachal Pradesh's Bir Billing, ANI reported. The incident took place when the helper who pushes the paraglider for take-off got tangled and was launched into the air along with them. Due to this, the paraglider lost balance.

366.title: Video shows Russian tank blowing up civilian car, killing elderly couple in Ukraine
366.article_body: A video has surfaced online, allegedly showing a Russian tank blowing up a civilian car and killing an elderly couple in Ukraine. The video shows the car coming to a stop before the tank fired at it. Another video of the incident shows the elderly man's body in the driver's seat, with the elderly woman's head resting on his shoulder.

367.title: Seize opportunity to export best quality wheat: PM Modi amid war
367.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine has increased the demand for India's wheat globally and this opportunity should be seized to export the best quality product. He said that the financial sector, import-export departments and shipping industry should make a "comprehensive effort" to help wheat and other exporters.

368.title: Haryana budget is a 'jugglery of words': Former CM Hooda
368.article_body: Former Haryana Chief Minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Tuesday described the budget presented by the BJP-led government as a "jugglery of words". Hooda further said that the government has cut economic progress and infrastructure budget by 3% even at a time of record unemployment. Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar presented the budget estimates for 2022-23 on Tuesday.

369.title: Former Ukrainian Prez Yanukovych tells Zelenskyy to 'stop the war'
369.article_body: Amid Russia-Ukraine tensions, ex-Ukrainian President Viktor Yanukovych has urged President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to "stop the war". Yanukovych, who's in exile in Russia since being ousted from power in 2014, has said that Zelenskyy should reach a peaceful consensus on the conflict. Notably, Ukrainian media recently reported that Russia wants to reinstate Yanukovych as Ukraine's leader after the war.

370.title: SC declines to hear plea seeking VVPAT verification before counting
370.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday refused to urgently hear a plea seeking the verification of Voter Verified Paper Audit Trail (VVPAT) of Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) before the counting of votes. "Let counting go on as per established practice," SC said. It said it would list the matter before an appropriate bench after counting is finished for Assembly polls.

371.title: Let's dedicate ACM Awards 2022 to people in Ukraine: Dolly Parton
371.article_body: Amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict, singer Dolly Parton voiced her support for the people in Ukraine while hosting the 57th Academy of Country Music Awards (ACM Awards 2022). "I want us to send our love and hope to our brothers and sisters in Ukraine," she said. She added, "Let's dedicate this whole show to them and pray for peace around this...world."

372.title: There's no alternative to PM Modi: WB BJP chief to Mamata Banerjee
372.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar on Tuesday said there's no alternative to PM Modi after CM Mamata Banerjee claimed that BJP will be ousted from power once people find a viable alternative. "Such a big target isn't good for [TMC's] health," Majumdar said. Earlier, Banerjee called BJP a "dangabaaz (rioter) and corrupt party" that wants to "destroy democracy".

373.title: Trained exactly like male colleagues: India's 1st female Rafale pilot
373.article_body: India's first female Rafale fighter pilot Flight Lieutenant Shivangi Singh said, "I've been trained exactly like my male colleagues". Speaking on the occasion of International Women's Day, Singh added, "The machine doesn't recognize gender, it acts as per the inputs given to it." She said the experience of becoming a fighter pilot has been thrilling and satisfying.

374.title: Resign in 24 hours: Pak Opposition to PM Imran Khan over poor governance
374.article_body: Pakistan's Opposition parties have moved a no-confidence motion seeking the ouster of PM Imran Khan and accused him of mismanaging the economy and poor governance. "Resign in 24 hours...face us in...election," Pakistan Peoples Party leader Bilawal Bhutto said during a rally. Meanwhile, Imran Khan vowed to fight any move to unseat him, saying, "Whatever they do, I'm ready for that."

375.title: 3 LeT terrorists arrested in J&K's Pulwama, grenade recovered
375.article_body: Three terrorists associated with the Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) have been arrested in J&K's Pulwama. Local police, along with 55 RR (Rashtriya Rifles) and 182 battalion of the CRPF, also recovered a grenade, 13 rounds of AK-47 and some incriminating material from their possession following the arrests. A senior police official said that the trio were terrorist Arif Hazar's associates.

376.title: Use own weapons in future wars: Indian Army chief on 'lesson' from Russia-Ukraine war
376.article_body: Speaking about the lessons India learnt from Russia-Ukraine war, Chief of the Army Staff MM Naravane said, "Biggest lesson is we've to be ready to fight future wars with indigenous weapons." "Steps towards Aatmanirbhar Bharat in defence have to be taken more urgently. Wars of future should be fought with own weapon systems," he added.

377.title: Man rapes & kills 9-yr-old after luring her with snacks in Aligarh
377.article_body: A man allegedly raped and murdered a nine-year-old girl after luring her with snacks in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh. The victim was reportedly bludgeoned to death with a brick by the accused, who was reportedly her uncle. Police arrested the man and said that he is a drug addict and was found in a semi-conscious state.

378.title: Ukraine running short of vital medical supplies amid war: WHO
378.article_body: The World Health Organization said on Tuesday that attacks on hospitals, ambulances and other health care facilities in Ukraine have increased rapidly, adding that nine people had died in 16 attacks on health care facilities since the start of a Russian invasion of Ukraine. The WHO further said the war-hit Ukraine is running short of vital medical supplies, including oxygen.

379.title: Suspended BJP leader Jay Prakash Majumdar joins TMC
379.article_body: Suspended BJP leader Jay Prakash Majumdar joined Trinamool Congress (TMC) on Tuesday in the presence of party supremo and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. He was also appointed as TMC's state Vice President. Majumdar, along with BJP leader Ritesh Tiwari, had been issued show-cause notices by BJP in January for alleged anti-party activities and were later suspended.

380.title: Actor dies fighting Russia in Ukraine; his last Instagram post shows him in army uniform
380.article_body: Ukrainian actor Pasha Lee, who decided to defend the country by joining the Territorial Defence Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine amid Russian invasion, has been killed in Russian shelling. In his last post a few days ago, the 33-year-old shared a picture of himself in a military uniform and wrote, "We are smiling because we will manage."

381.title: Man tied up with his pants down after he's caught stealing in Ukraine amid war
381.article_body: A man who was allegedly caught looting in Kyiv during Russian attacks on the city was tied to a lamp post with his pants down as punishment. He was pictured standing near a petrol station in Ukraine's capital, unable to move after being caught by locals. There have been reports of looting in areas across Ukraine since the invasion began.

382.title: A tragedy we will never come to terms with: Shane Warne's parents on his demise
382.article_body: Releasing a statement following the death of Shane Warne, the Australian cricket legend's parents Keith and Brigitte said that his demise is a tragedy they will never come to terms with. "Looking to a future without Shane is inconceivable, hopefully the mountain of happy memories we all have will help us cope with our ongoing grief," they added.

383.title: EVMs stolen in Varanasi, SP workers stopped truck: Akhilesh as video surfaces
383.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday alleged that EVMs are being stolen in Varanasi. He also claimed that SP workers intercepted a truck full of EVMs, a video of which has surfaced. "We need to be alert if EVMs are being transported," he added. Meanwhile, Varanasi DM Kaushal Raj Sharma claimed these EVMs were being used for training.

384.title: India promoting greater roles for girls in armed forces: PM Modi
384.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on International Women's Day said the country is promoting greater roles for girls in the armed forces and now the admission of girls has started in Sainik Schools. He was virtually addressing a seminar in Gujarat's Kutch. "Today the priority of the country lies in the full participation of women in India's development journey," he added.

385.title: 4 security personnel killed, 20 others injured in blast in Pakistan
385.article_body: Four security personnel were killed and over 20 were injured in a blast in Pakistan's Balochistan, according to police. The blast occurred in Balochistan's Sibi district, where the annual Sibi mela was being held. "It took place after Pakistan President Arif Alvi attended the festival in Sibi," Hafeez Rind, a senior official of Counter-Terrorism Department Sibi was quoted as saying.

386.title: When you're passionate about your craft, you want to reinvent: Divya
386.article_body: Actress Divya Dutta said she's being offered roles that she had never portrayed before. Divya added people wanted to do glamorous roles in earlier times, however, they are now opting for story-oriented roles. "The range of roles being offered have become bigger and better," she stated. Divya added, "When you are passionate about your craft, you always want to reinvent."

387.title: US CDC urges citizens to avoid travel to NZ, Hong Kong & Thailand
387.article_body: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on Monday urged citizens to avoid travel to New Zealand, Hong Kong and Thailand due to rising COVID-19 cases. The CDC updated its travel recommendation for all three countries to its highest level, "Level Four: Very High". India is currently on the CDC's third level, "Level Three: High".

388.title: Our goal is to forge a non-BJP front in Goa: Cong's Chidambaram
388.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram said Congress is open to an alliance with anti-BJP parties and that talks regarding the same have begun. "Our goal is to forge a non-BJP front and such efforts are going on in other parts of India," he said. This comes a day after a majority of the exit polls predicted a hung assembly in Goa.

389.title: We'll punish everyone who committed atrocities in war: Ukraine Prez
389.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has warned that the country will "not forgive or forget the premeditated murder" being carried out by Russian President Vladimir Putin and his forces. He said, "We will not forgive. We will not forget. We will punish everyone who committed atrocities in this war." "[Instead] of forgiveness there will be a day of judgment," he added.

390.title: Global COVID-19 death toll passes 6 million mark: Reports
390.article_body: The global COVID-19 death toll on Monday passed 6 million as per data collected by Johns Hopkins University in the US. The last one million COVID-19 deaths reportedly occurred in the past four months. Due to poor record-keeping and testing in several parts of the world, many experts believe the six million figure is lower than the actual death count.

391.title: Porn content on social media responsible for rape of minor girls: Raj minister
391.article_body: Rajasthan minister Shanti Kumar Dhariwal on Tuesday blamed pornographic content available on social media for rape of minor girls. "Inhuman tendency is being developed among youth and obscene content on social media is the main reason for this. This content is...served in an unrestricted manner," he said. Rajasthan recorded 5,793 cases of rape of minor girls in last three years.

392.title: Cong to move its candidates to resort before Goa poll result: Reports
392.article_body: Ahead of the Goa Assembly poll result on March 10 (Thursday), all Congress candidates will be staying in a resort in North Goa on Wednesday, reports said. The Congress candidates will be heading towards the counting stations from the resort, as per the reports. This comes after exit polls predicted a hung Assembly in Goa.

393.title: Will support Poland if it decides to send jets to Ukraine: UK
393.article_body: UK Defence Secretary Ben Wallace on Tuesday said Britain would support Poland if it decided to send fighter jets to Ukraine. "I would support the Poles and whatever choice they make," he said. Wallace added Britain would not be able to offer Ukraine any aircraft. "We would protect Poland, we'll help them with anything that they need," he said.

394.title: All Indian students moved out of Ukraine's Sumy: Govt as it shares video
394.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi on Tuesday tweeted, "Happy to inform that we have been able to move out all Indian students from Sumy. They are currently en route to Poltava, from where they will board trains to western Ukraine." Sharing a video of students, Bagchi added that Operation Ganga flights are being prepared to bring them home.

395.title: BJP's exit from UP is certain: Tejashwi Yadav ahead of poll results
395.article_body: Reacting to exit polls on UP Assembly elections, Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav has said that the BJP's departure from UP is certain. "The anger we have seen amongst the people for the [UP] government clearly gives the message that [BJP] is not going to win and Akhilesh Ji will form the government," Yadav added.

396.title: Child dies of dehydration in Ukraine's city after days without water or power
396.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Tuesday a child had died from dehydration in Ukraine's besieged city of Mariupol, which has had no water, power or heating supplies for days. "In 2022, from dehydration," Zelenskyy said in a video address, likening the crisis linked to Russian bombardment of Ukrainian cities to that created by Nazi invasion during World War Two.

397.title: Nearly 18,000 Indians brought back from Ukraine since Feb 22: Govt
397.article_body: The Ministry of Civil Aviation informed on Tuesday that nearly 18,000 Indians have been repatriated from war-hit Ukraine since February 22. "The number of Indians airlifted by 75 special civilian flights goes up to 15,521. IAF had flown 12 missions to bring back 2,467 passengers, as part of the Operation Ganga," it added. Twenty-eight flights were operated from Budapest.

398.title: Mumbai Police probing extortion charges against 4 ED officers: Raut
398.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut has said the Mumbai Police were investigating extortion charges against four Enforcement Directorate officers, adding that "some of them will go to jail". He said, "ED and some of its officials have become...ATM for...BJP." His remarks come on a day when Income Tax department conducted raids on premises linked to Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray's aide.

399.title: TMC could've done better if we had more time: Mamata on Goa polls
399.article_body: Ahead of Goa Assembly poll results, Trinamool Congress (TMC) supremo Mamata Banerjee said on Tuesday that party could've done better if it had more time. "I'm happy that we were able to reach out to every family in Goa with our logo [but]...We...started late," she added. TMC had previously said it's open to post-poll alliance with like-minded parties in Goa.

400.title: Ukraine war may have limited impact on domestic credit market: Report
400.article_body: An India Ratings and Research (IRR) report said Russia-Ukraine war's impact on the domestic credit market may be limited as the banking system has adequate liquidity. The duration and intensity of the war will be the key determinant for the macro and micro risks. Entities with a weak financial profile may face financing challenges if the situation worsens, it added.

401.title: Fire breaks out at Delhi plastic factory, 100 firefighters deployed
401.article_body: A fire broke out at a plastic factory in Delhi's Bawana area on Tuesday morning. According to officials, the fire broke out at 6:30 am when 50 workers were present inside. Delhi Fire Service said they deployed 25 fire tenders and 100 firefighters to the spot. Officials said they also used a drone in the firefighting operation.

402.title: House of suspect raided by NIA in Pune's Kondhwa over ISKP case
402.article_body: A suspect's house was raided by the NIA in connection with a case of planning terrorist attacks in India. Officials said searches were conducted at 38-year-old Talha Khan's residence in Kondhwa, Pune, on Monday over propagating terrorist group ISIS' ideology as part of outlawed Islamic State Khorasan Province (ISKP) activities. Various incriminating documents and digital devices were seized.
